title: Mind Tricks (Peter Parker X Fem!Reader) *PLATONIC
body:
Characters: Peter Parker X Fem!Reader *PLATONIC

Universe: Marvel, Avengers, Spiderman

Warnings: None

Request: Hi there! Can I request a one shot with Peter Parker where they’re both superheroes and they have to sneak out of school to go on a mission and nearly get caught? Thanks!    Hello again! I’m the one that requested the Peter x reader one about sneaking out of school, but I forgot to mention that I’d like the reader to be female. Sorry for any confusion lol

Peter could feel you messing with him, and it was getting on his nerves. Mostly because 1) he was in a lesson, and 2) You weren’t even in his lesson! You were on the opposite side of the school, so he couldn’t just turn around and tell you to knock it off.

You were using your telepathy to mess with his mind, making him feel the presence of a gentle but constant tapping on the back of his head. You could put your own voice in his head and have him respond, but you were too far away to do that. Despite this, it was pretty obvious you wanted his attention. However, he knew that even if you couldn’t project your voice, he could do it and you’d hear.

“What is is? We’re in lesson. Give me a hint or something.” He thought. He then felt his hand start to shake a little, becoming a little numb- you were messing with his head to control his hand. The shaking was from the distance. Eventually his fingers curled in, except his thumb and pinky that remained open. “Phone.” He realised. The numbness went away, telling him he had guessed right. He proceeded to knock his pencil onto the floor and used it to go into his bag and check his phone.

Robbery and possible hostage situation downtown in jewel store, meet me outside Nurse’s office!

He silently cursed. He realised now you weren’t doing it to annoy him, it was to warn him. He quickly thought, before acting, raising his hand, not waiting for his teacher to ask him. “Sir, can I please go to the bathroom- I’m gonna be sick.” He rushed out. His teacher, seeing the panic in his eyes, nodded, and Peter quickly grabbed his bag and rushed out. He rushed down the hallways till he saw you waiting outside the Nurse’s station.

“Took you long enough.” You greeted. “Come on, it only got announced 10 minutes ago.” You told him, starting to run as well beside him, while also being cautious to not be too loud and being careful for any teachers.

Peter sensed the presence around the corner, and he grabbed your hand and stopped you from turning the corner, instead pushing you and himself against the wall. He peeked around the side. He felt the small, almost unnoticeable pressure behind his eyes, telling him you were looking into his head to look through his eyes and to see what he was seeing. What he saw, was a teacher heading your way. The hallway only had one way to go, and that was turning into your direction. What was even more frustrating was that behind that teacher was the exit.

Peter looked behind him, past you, hoping to find a quick hiding spot, but the lockers were a good few feet away, and a bin even further. You thought quickly, and instead of running, you grabbed peter’s hand and put the other hand around his arm to tell him to keep still. You kept your eyes focussed on the corner till the teacher turned it, and you focussed. You focussed hard, seeming to glare at the teacher, but he didn’t seem to notice you. Peter remained silent until the teacher was well out of ear shot, before looking at you. You were facing away, still staring at the teacher.

“How did he not notice us?” He whispered. You sighed, finally turning back, and Peter got his answer. “You’re bleeding again.” He informed you, quickly shrugging off his bag in search of some tissues he knew he had- he’d carry them around specifically for this purpose- whenever you went above and beyond the usual of your powers, a nose bleed ensued. He found the tissues, offering them to you. You smiled, taking them and pressing it to your top lip, standing up with Peter and heading for the door. “What did you do?” He asked.

“I forced his mind to not notice us. I basically made us invisible in his vision. I’ve been practising it all week, and good thing to.” You told him. As soon as you were out those doors you were off, ready to save people and to fight crime.

Hope you liked it! If you have any questions, please send them in! 

*Not my gif

by HappyFabulousManatee

Stephen Strange tries to make paper cranes for his adopted daughter’s birthday. Fortunately, he has the best lifemate and adopted son he could ask for.

Me trying to find a reason to write Stephen and Tony making paper cranes.

body:
Hot take

The only reason why we didn’t get to see the fight between the asgardians and thanos and co is because the asgardians should have won or at least thanos and so should’ve been hurt after the fight but the russos couldn’t have that for the sake of their “narrative”.

And yes I know they were possibly still tired from fighting Hela but consider this:

Thor is very strong and could’ve blasted them

Valkyrie is very skilled and strong

There are more fighters on bord (Doug)

Loki is has and can wield an infinity stone (which he didn’t use because???)

Heimdall is really powerful

They have a hulk

In conclusion the Russo brothers are cowards who took the easy way out

This Wednesday, August 8th, Marvel Comics is set to release AMAZING SPIDER-MAN (2018) #3. The creative team for this issue features writing from Nick Spencer, art from Ryan Ottley, inks by Cliff Rathburn, colors by Laura Martin, and lettering from VC’s Joe Caramagna.

Marvel Comics’ new release on New Comic Book Day…

MARVEL COMICS
IN STORES THIS WEEK

New Release for the week of August 8th, 2018

~~~~~

AMAZING SPIDER-MAN (2018) #3

Writer: Nick Spencer
Artist: Ryan Ottley
Inker: Cliff Rathburn
Colorist: Laura Martin
Letterer: Joe Caramagna
Main Cover Artists: Ryan Ottley & Laura Martin
Variant Cover Artist: Steve Epting

Things are crazy for Spider-Man. His personal life in turmoil AND the giant TRI-SENTINEL has returned to attack NYC!

~~~~~

title: Welcome to Starbucks
body:
Steve didn’t have a problem with the words on his arm, per se, but he wasn’t really happy with them. At least he could be comforted by the fact that his soulmate had beautiful handwriting. Steve was born with the phrase “Welcome to Starbucks! May I take your order?” written on his skin in large loopy script.

He didn’t have anything against Starbucks. Actually it was quite the opposite; he really liked Starbucks. Steve’s main issue was the fact that living in Brooklyn meant there were more Starbucks locations within 20 minutes of his home than there were actual restaurants. Steve could spend a month at a time just learning about all of the employees at one location, and even then he would have to move on to the next one.

Steve’s coffee addiction started when he was a teenager. He wanted to meet his soulmate. His mom told him that was part of the reason that he never passed 5 foot 5; the coffee stunted his growth.

Steve tried to never get his hopes up when he got up to the counter. The odds of the barista actually being his soulmate were quite low. He was never too upset when he figured out that he wasn’t talking to the person that he was meant to be with. And yes there were quite a few people who he may have fantasized about saying the right thing to. Sam later became his best friend. And Peggy convinced the Starbucks to hang his paintings. And Steve was able to introduce Natasha to her soulmate. There were no hard feelings.

By the time Steve was 25, things were a little harder. Starbucks was a little too expensive for a guy who illustrated children’s books, and not meeting his soulmate was starting to get to him. He decided to save going to Starbucks for saturday mornings, and use the opportunity to work on his comic book.

Steve was running extremely late for a meeting with a client. His only saving grace was the fact that they were meeting at a Starbucks 5 minutes away from his apartment. He could skip breakfast and get something to eat there while he waited.

Steve hightailed it to the Starbucks, arriving 10 minutes before his client, Pepper, said she would meet him. He got in line and waited. Steve was so lost in his own world that he didn’t notice that he was next until somebody said, “Welcome to Starbucks, May I take your order?”

Steve looked up at the barista in front of him. The guy was tall with long dark hair that was pulled into a bun. He had the most striking eyes that Steve had ever seen. Steve was pretty sure that this guy, Bucky as his nametag said, was wasting his modeling potential on being a barista.

Before he could really stop himself steve mumbled, “There is no way, I’m this lucky.”

Bucky stared at him. “No way.” he pulled the sleeve of his shirt up and said, “Does yours say, Welcome to starbucks, may I take your order?”

“Y- yes.”

Bucky, ran out from behind the counter while yelling, “Scott take over for me for like a minute. Something came up.” He bounded over, stopping right in front of Steve with a huge grin. “I’m Bucky, and I think we might be soulmates.” Before Steve could respond, Bucky pulled him into a tight hug. He pulled away and said, “Sorry I didn’t even ask your name.”

“I’m Steve.”

“Nice to meet you Steve.”

“I’m not gonna lie,” Bucky said as they sat down on their first real date, “I was pretty sure that I was going to meet somebody who had just won the lottery.”

“I think I did win the lottery. The soulmate lottery.”

“God you are such a dork.”

“Hey the universe said we were meant to be together, clearly at least part of you is into that.”

“Oh all of me is definitely into that.”

Steve was born with the phrase “Welcome to Starbucks! May I take your order?” written on his skin in large loopy script.

He didn’t have anything against Starbucks. Actually it was quite the opposite; he really liked Starbucks. Steve’s main issue was the fact that living in Brooklyn meant there were more Starbucks locations within 20 minutes of his home than there were actual restaurants. Steve could spend a month at a time just learning about all of the employees at one location, and even then he would have to move on to the next one.

Steve’s coffee addiction started when he was a teenager. He wanted to meet his soulmate. His mom told him that was part of the reason that he never passed 5 foot 5; the coffee stunted his growth.

Steve tried to never get his hopes up when he got up to the counter. The odds of the barista actually being his soulmate were quite low. He was never too upset when he figured out that he wasn’t talking to the person that he was meant to be with. And yes there were quite a few people who he may have fantasized about saying the right thing to. Sam later became his best friend. And Peggy convinced the Starbucks to hang his paintings. And Steve was able to introduce Natasha to her soulmate. There were no hard feelings.

By the time Steve was 25, things were a little harder. Starbucks was a little too expensive for a guy who illustrated children’s books, and not meeting his soulmate was starting to get to him. He decided to save going to Starbucks for saturday mornings, and use the opportunity to work on his comic book.

[[MORE]]

Steve was running extremely late for a meeting with a client. His only saving grace was the fact that they were meeting at a Starbucks 5 minutes away from his apartment. He could skip breakfast and get something to eat there while he waited.

Steve hightailed it to the Starbucks, arriving 10 minutes before his client, Pepper, said she would meet him. He got in line and waited. Steve was so lost in his own world that he didn’t notice that he was next until somebody said, “Welcome to Starbucks, May I take your order?”

Steve looked up at the barista in front of him. The guy was tall with long dark hair that was pulled into a bun. He had the most striking eyes that Steve had ever seen. Steve was pretty sure that this guy, Bucky as his nametag said, was wasting his modeling potential on being a barista.

Before he could really stop himself steve mumbled, “There is no way, I’m this lucky.”

Bucky stared at him. “No way.” he pulled the sleeve of his shirt up and said, “Does yours say, Welcome to starbucks, may I take your order?”

“Y- yes.”

Bucky, ran out from behind the counter while yelling, “Scott take over for me for like a minute. Something came up.” He bounded over, stopping right in front of Steve with a huge grin. “I’m Bucky, and I think we might be soulmates.” Before Steve could respond, Bucky pulled him into a tight hug. He pulled away and said, “Sorry I didn’t even ask your name.”

“I’m Steve.”

“Nice to meet you Steve.”

“I’m not gonna lie,” Bucky said as they sat down on their first real date, “I was pretty sure that I was going to meet somebody who had just won the lottery.”

“I think I did win the lottery. The soulmate lottery.”

“God you are such a dork.”

“Hey the universe said we were meant to be together, clearly at least part of you is into that.”

“Oh all of me is definitely into that.”

summary: @nightrainn2 : Hello, may I request a male ship for Marvel, GoT Sherlock & Assassin's creed (if it's alright that I ask for 4),...
body:
@nightrainn2 : Hello, may I request a male ship for Marvel, GoT Sherlock & Assassin’s creed (if it’s alright that I ask for 4), please & thank you. I hope the length is alright, if not send me a message in the chat box and let me know. I’m putting it in a link to the tumblr blog with my personality description, I hope it works . LINK - The first part is shortintrovertships(.) tumblr(.) (com) (without the parentheses). You can take as much time as you need, I don’t mind being patient & waiting.

I ship you with… Tony Stark!

Tony is as stubborn and sarcastic as you are, making your relationship a little difficult sometimes. You fix it anyway and be there for him, whenever he needs a shoulder to lean on or just someone to talk to.

I ship you with… Jon Snow!

Jon dislikes the same things as you, what makes your relationship work even better, because you try to make the world a better place with the same intention. He doesn’t always understand your sarcasm, but tries to as good as possible.

I ship you with… John Watson!

You like the same things and have a really strong relationship with each other, thanks to your same interests and personality. He’s loyal and you’re too, so it’s obvious from the beginning that it will last for a long time.

I ship you with… Connor Kenway!

He hates to see animals suffer or being hurt. Not only animals, living creatures in general. You’re both standing up for what’s right and he can always look behind your mask.
